alert.note: Alert for Larimer (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 10:35PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM MDT FRIDAY FOR A PORTION OF THE CAMERON PEAK BURN AREA... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Colorado, including the following county, Larimer. * WHEN...Until 130 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry gulches. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1032 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain moving into the burn area north of Glen Haven. This will cause small stream flooding. - Miller Fork and Pennock Pass are the most likely places to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.3 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pennock Pass and Miller Gulch north of Glen Haven. - This includes the following additional locations... Box Prairie.
info.instruction: Be prepared for significant rises in creeks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
